text: America has a nuclear waste problem
specifically there's no place to put it
currently most wastes from power plants
is stored on-site while the government
buries the waste from the production of
nuclear weapons 2150 feet underground at
the Waste Isolation Pilot Plant in New
Mexico but that facility will be sealed
off by 2035 in 1987
Nevada's Yucca Mountain was designated
as the place for the permanent storage
of nuclear waste the location is right
by the Nevada Test Site and about 80
miles northwest of Las Vegas the plan
was to make it the home to all of
America's nuclear waste and develop
facilities inside the mountain that
would be able to hold 150 million pounds
of nuclear waste for at least 10,000
years the original plan called for the
site to open in 1998 but red tape local
opposition and environmentalists have
all played suit on various delays one
survey found two-thirds of Nevadans felt
it was unfair for the state to have to
store the country's nuclear waste when
there are no nuclear power plants in
Nevada and critics worry groundwater in
the mountain could corrode the canisters
storing the waste which will cause
radioactive material to leak out of the
canisters in 2009 then Energy Secretary
Steven Chu told the Senate the mountain
was no longer an option for storing
nuclear waste it helped that then
Senator Harry Reid was from Nevada
opposed the project and had just become
Senate Majority Leader Chu and Reid
weren't able to cancel the project but
they did delayed indefinitely by not
taking any action on president Trump's
budget plan would revive this project it
provides a hundred twenty million
dollars to restart the approval process
for Yucca Mountain
but that still requires congressional
approval and the state of Nevada has
filed 218 contentions against the
Department of Energy's application for
the storage site the state of Nevada
could also sue the federal government
over the radiation protection standards
currently governing the site so legal
battles can't I'd the process up in
hearings for four to five years and cost
the government two billion dollars
opponents of the site do have a new
argument in their arsenal trains hauling
nuclear waste to the mountain will be
running just a half mile away from
Trump's hotel in Las Vegas
